{"step_by_step_thinking": "The child was admitted on 7 days of life with severe respiratory distress and shock, but was discharged healthy just two days prior. This sudden onset of symptoms suggests a congenital heart defect. The presence of severe respiratory distress and shock at presentation further supports this diagnosis. Among the options, Hypoplastic left heart syndrome is a likely cause given its association with early onset of cardiovascular symptoms.", "answer_choice": B}
